articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The families of Israeli hostages held by Hamas in the Gaza Strip have been racked with worry for their loved ones since the military stepped up ground assaults inside the Palestinian territory, a group lobbying for the families said on Saturday.
articles.title: 'Anxiety' racks Israeli hostage families as army assaults Gaza

articles.author: Ece Toksabay, Dilara Senkaya
articles.description: President Tayyip Erdogan will join on Saturday what is expected to be one of the largest pro-Palestinian rallies since the Israel-Hamas war began, courting his Islamist political base a day ahead of the centenary of Turkey's secular republic.
articles.title: Erdogan to address pro-Palestinian rally on eve of Turkey's centenary

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Saturday it had stopped a surface-to-air missile fired from Lebanon at one of its drones and the Lebanese authorities issued precautionary guidance in case it has to evacuate Beirut airport, as border tensions climb.
articles.title: Israel stops missile from Lebanon, as Beirut takes airport precautions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi on Saturday warned against any expansion of the conflict in Gaza, saying the region risked becoming a "ticking time bomb".
articles.title: Egypt's Sisi warns region could become 'ticking time bomb'

articles.author: Ahmed Mohamed Hassan, Dan Williams
articles.description: Drones caused explosions that rocked two Egyptian towns on the Red Sea on Friday, the Egyptian army said, while Israel said Yemen's Iran-backed Houthi movement sent them to strike Israel.
articles.title: Drone blasts hit two Egyptian Red Sea towns, Israel points to Houthi

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jeff Mason
articles.description: The United States is not trying to dictate limits for Israel, the White House said on Friday, as the Israelis expanded their military operation in Gaza against Hamas militants.
articles.title: US not drawing red lines for Israel -White House

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: With an economy in ruins and a crumbling state, Lebanon can ill afford another war between Hezbollah and Israel.
articles.title: Broken Lebanon cannot afford war between Hezbollah and Israel

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli air and ground forces are stepping up operations in the Gaza Strip, Israel's chief military spokesperson said on Friday, amid reports of heavy bombing of the besieged enclave.
articles.title: Israel stepping up ground operations in Gaza Strip

articles.author: Gabriella Borter
articles.description: A U.S. Army reservist accused of spraying a bowling alley and bar with gunfire in Lewiston, Maine, killing 18 people, was found dead after a 48-hour manhunt, restoring calm to communities unnerved by the bloodshed but leaving many questions unanswered.
articles.title: US army reservist suspected in Lewiston, Maine, shootings found dead, likely suicide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's aviation regulator will increase domestic flights to 34% above pre-pandemic levels, state news agency Xinhua reported, a move that will further boost the post-pandemic recovery of Chinese airlines.
articles.title: Flights in China to increase 34% above pre-pandemic levels
